newsitem.title: USA: San Francisco policeman found dead in car.
newsitem.headline: San Francisco policeman found dead in car.

text.p: A high-ranking San Francisco police officer was found dead in his car Wednesday, police said, apparently of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
Captain Thomas Petrini, 49, was found in his vehicle in the parking lot of the police department's firing range, police said. He had just finished his shift.
Police spokesman Lt. David Robinson declined to give details of the shooting, saying it was under investigation. But he said: "There was nothing to indicate a homicide."
News reports said Petrini committed suicide.
Petrini, a 27-year police veteran, had risen to deputy chief but was demoted to captain last year in a department reshuffle. At the time of his death, he was in charge of the staff services division.
Colleagues were shocked by his death.

Robinson said Petrini had a distinguished career and was a well-respected officer. "This is a tragedy for all of us, he will be sorely missed. It's tough to lose one of our own under any circumstances, particularly in this manner."
Police officers said they knew of no reason why Petrini would take his own life. He was survived by a wife and two children.
